topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c9d59363687271036d1000#post_54c9d59363687271036d1000
I have to admit that that's something which really pisses me off in fiction. Having a mystery which goes unresolved is fine, but when it keeps getting brought up only for the writers to thwart any attempt to resolve it, it becomes less "mystery" and more "deliberately playing coy because the writers think it makes them look clever."
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

topics.body:
"@Silent_Witness":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c9d69c6368722a835d0400#post_54c9d69c6368722a835d0400
It's the Lost problem.
In order for your mystery to be engaging it needs a sensible ending.
